description: College-level calculus course covering limits, continuity, differentiation, integration, and advanced topics to prepare students for AP exams and higher-level mathematics.

topics.name: Unit 1: Limits & Continuity
topics.description: Concepts of limits, one-sided limits, continuity, limits at infinity, asymptotes, and foundational understanding for derivatives.

topics.name: Unit 2: Differentiation
topics.description: Derivative definition, rules of differentiation, chain/product/quotient rules, implicit differentiation, higher-order derivatives, and applications in motion and optimization.

topics.name: Unit 3: Integration
topics.description: Indefinite and definite integrals, fundamental theorem of calculus, substitution, integration by parts, area under curves, and applications in physics and economics.

topics.name: Unit 4: Advanced Topics
topics.description: Sequences and series, parametric equations, polar coordinates, differential equations, and advanced problem-solving techniques for AP-level calculus.
